item.title: CAMEL-Bench: A Comprehensive Arabic LMM Benchmark
item.description: CAMEL-Bench: a new Arabic LMM benchmark enabling comprehensive evaluation of large multimodal models across eight diverse domains, revealing significant room for improvement even in state-of-the-art m…

item.title: CCI3.0-HQ: a large-scale Chinese dataset of high quality designed for pre-training large language models
item.description: CCI3.0-HQ: A new 500GB high-quality Chinese dataset boosts Chinese LLM performance, outperforming existing datasets on key benchmarks.

item.title: Data Scaling Laws in Imitation Learning for Robotic Manipulation
item.description: Robotic manipulation policies achieve near 90% success in novel environments and with unseen objects using a data-efficient imitation learning approach guided by discovered power-law scaling laws.

item.title: DeCoRe: Decoding by Contrasting Retrieval Heads to Mitigate Hallucinations
item.description: DeCoRe, a training-free decoding strategy, significantly reduces LLM hallucinations by contrasting outputs from masked and unmasked retrieval heads, improving contextual faithfulness.

item.title: Distill Visual Chart Reasoning Ability from LLMs to MLLMs
item.description: Researchers created REACHQA, a dataset improving visual reasoning in LLMs by using code as an intermediary to translate chart representations into text, enabling efficient and scalable data synthesis.

item.title: Framer: Interactive Frame Interpolation
item.description: Framer: a novel interactive frame interpolation method allows users to customize video transitions by intuitively adjusting keypoints, resulting in seamless and creative video generation.

item.title: LOGO -- Long cOntext aliGnment via efficient preference Optimization
item.description: LOGO, a novel training strategy, significantly enhances long-context language model generation by efficiently optimizing preferences, achieving performance comparable to GPT-4 on real-world tasks with…

item.title: MotionCLR: Motion Generation and Training-free Editing via Understanding Attention Mechanisms
item.description: MotionCLR: Training-free human motion editing via attention mechanism manipulation.

item.title: Robust Watermarking Using Generative Priors Against Image Editing: From Benchmarking to Advances
item.description: VINE: A novel watermarking method significantly enhances robustness against advanced image editing techniques while maintaining high image quality, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Should We Really Edit Language Models? On the Evaluation of Edited Language Models
item.description: Language model editing, while efficient for small updates, causes inevitable performance drops and safety issues when scaled, urging a reassessment of its practical applications.

item.title: Skywork-Reward: Bag of Tricks for Reward Modeling in LLMs
item.description: Skywork-Reward achieves state-of-the-art results on RewardBench using a smaller, high-quality preference dataset and refined training techniques, highlighting the importance of data curation in LLM re…

item.title: SMITE: Segment Me In TimE
item.description: SMITE: a novel method for flexible-granularity video segmentation using only a few reference images, achieving temporally consistent results with superior accuracy.

item.title: Stable Consistency Tuning: Understanding and Improving Consistency Models
item.description: Stable Consistency Tuning (SCT) boosts consistency model speed and quality by reducing training variance and discretization errors, achieving new state-of-the-art results on ImageNet-64.

item.title: Taipan: Efficient and Expressive State Space Language Models with Selective Attention
item.description: Taipan, a hybrid language model, efficiently handles long contexts (up to 1 million tokens) by selectively applying attention, outperforming existing models in both speed and accuracy.

item.title: The Nature of Mathematical Modeling and Probabilistic Optimization Engineering in Generative AI
item.description: This paper enhances Transformer models by applying probabilistic optimization, yielding efficient subword encoding, hyperparameter optimization, and novel attention mechanisms for improved generative …

item.title: Unbounded: A Generative Infinite Game of Character Life Simulation
item.description: UNBOUNDED, a generative infinite game, uses AI to create an open-ended character life simulation where players interact using natural language, transcending traditional game design.

item.title: Unleashing Reasoning Capability of LLMs via Scalable Question Synthesis from Scratch
item.description: ScaleQuest synthesizes a million high-quality mathematical reasoning problems using efficient open-source methods, substantially boosting LLM reasoning performance.

item.title: WAFFLE: Multi-Modal Model for Automated Front-End Development
item.description: WAFFLE, a novel multi-modal model, revolutionizes front-end development by accurately translating UI designs into HTML code using structure-aware attention and contrastive learning, significantly outp…

item.title: Why Does the Effective Context Length of LLMs Fall Short?
item.description: Researchers unveil why LLMs underperform with long contexts, attributing it to skewed position frequency distribution, and introduce STRING, a training-free method that dramatically enhances long-cont…

item.title: ADEM-VL: Adaptive and Embedded Fusion for Efficient Vision-Language Tuning
item.description: ADEM-VL: A novel vision-language tuning framework achieves state-of-the-art accuracy with significantly reduced computational cost and parameters, using a parameter-free cross-attention mechanism and …

item.title: Asynchronous RLHF: Faster and More Efficient Off-Policy RL for Language Models
item.description: Asynchronous RLHF accelerates language model training by 40% with improved efficiency, matching the performance of synchronous methods.

item.title: DynamicCity: Large-Scale LiDAR Generation from Dynamic Scenes
item.description: DynamicCity generates large-scale, high-quality 4D LiDAR scenes capturing dynamic environments, improving autonomous driving system development.

item.title: Lightweight Neural App Control
item.description: LiMAC, a lightweight neural app control architecture, uses a hybrid approach combining a small Action Transformer with a fine-tuned vision-language model for precise, real-time mobile app control, out…

item.title: MIA-DPO: Multi-Image Augmented Direct Preference Optimization For Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: MIA-DPO boosts large vision-language model performance on multi-image tasks by cleverly augmenting single-image data and using attention mechanisms to filter out inaccurate responses.

item.title: Multi-Draft Speculative Sampling: Canonical Architectures and Theoretical Limits
item.description: Researchers boosted Large Language Model inference speed by using multiple draft models and a novel token selection scheme, improving block efficiency and token rates.

item.title: Scalable Ranked Preference Optimization for Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Researchers created a scalable method for aligning text-to-image models using synthetic preference datasets and a novel ranking-based optimization, significantly improving image quality and prompt-fol…

item.title: Scaling Diffusion Language Models via Adaptation from Autoregressive Models
item.description: Researchers efficiently adapt large autoregressive language models into competitive diffusion language models, overcoming previous scalability challenges and demonstrating improved performance on vari…

item.title: TP-Eval: Tap Multimodal LLMs' Potential in Evaluation by Customizing Prompts
item.description: TP-Eval unveils the hidden potential of MLLMs by customizing prompts to mitigate evaluation bias caused by prompt sensitivity, leading to a more accurate assessment of model capabilities.

item.title: Value Residual Learning For Alleviating Attention Concentration In Transformers
item.description: ResFormer & SVFormer alleviate Transformer attention concentration, boosting performance and reducing memory needs, paving the way for more efficient large language models.

item.title: WorldSimBench: Towards Video Generation Models as World Simulators
item.description: WorldSimBench: A new benchmark rigorously evaluates video generation models’ ability to simulate realistic, actionable videos, advancing embodied AI.

item.title: ZIP-FIT: Embedding-Free Data Selection via Compression-Based Alignment
item.description: ZIP-FIT: a novel data selection method uses gzip compression to efficiently identify task-relevant data, significantly boosting model performance and reducing training time.

item.title: Aligning Large Language Models via Self-Steering Optimization
item.description: Self-Steering Optimization (SSO) autonomously generates high-quality preference signals for aligning LLMs, eliminating manual annotation and improving model performance significantly.

item.title: Breaking the Memory Barrier: Near Infinite Batch Size Scaling for Contrastive Loss
item.description: Inf-CL breaks the memory barrier in contrastive learning, enabling near-infinite batch size scaling and drastically reducing memory costs without sacrificing accuracy.

item.title: Frontiers in Intelligent Colonoscopy
item.description: Revolutionizing colonoscopy, this study introduces ColonINST, a massive multimodal dataset, and ColonGPT, a powerful language model, enabling interactive, AI-assisted colonoscopy and improving diagnos…

item.title: JMMMU: A Japanese Massive Multi-discipline Multimodal Understanding Benchmark for Culture-aware Evaluation
item.description: JMMMU, a new Japanese benchmark, provides a comprehensive culture-aware evaluation for Large Multimodal Models, revealing significant performance gaps and highlighting the need for culturally diverse …

item.title: LongVU: Spatiotemporal Adaptive Compression for Long Video-Language Understanding
item.description: LongVU: A novel spatiotemporal compression method enables efficient long-video understanding by selectively reducing redundant video frames and tokens, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: LVSM: A Large View Synthesis Model with Minimal 3D Inductive Bias
item.description: LVSM, a novel transformer-based model, achieves state-of-the-art novel view synthesis by eliminating 3D inductive biases, leading to superior quality, scalability, and zero-shot generalization.

item.title: Math Neurosurgery: Isolating Language Models' Math Reasoning Abilities Using Only Forward Passes
item.description: Math Neurosurgery precisely isolates LLMs’ math skills using only forward passes, boosting their math performance significantly without affecting other abilities.

item.title: MiniPLM: Knowledge Distillation for Pre-Training Language Models
item.description: MINIPLM: A novel knowledge distillation framework boosts smaller language models’ performance during pre-training by efficiently refining training data distributions with a teacher model’s knowledge, …

item.title: PyramidDrop: Accelerating Your Large Vision-Language Models via Pyramid Visual Redundancy Reduction
item.description: PyramidDrop accelerates large vision-language models by efficiently reducing visual redundancy in deeper layers, achieving significant speedups in training and inference without performance loss.

item.title: SpectroMotion: Dynamic 3D Reconstruction of Specular Scenes
item.description: SpectroMotion reconstructs dynamic specular scenes with photorealistic accuracy by combining 3D Gaussian Splatting, physically-based rendering, and deformation fields, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: 3DGS-Enhancer: Enhancing Unbounded 3D Gaussian Splatting with View-consistent 2D Diffusion Priors
item.description: 3DGS-Enhancer boosts realistic 3D scene generation from limited viewpoints by cleverly using 2D video diffusion priors to improve 3D view consistency.

item.title: Agent-to-Sim: Learning Interactive Behavior Models from Casual Longitudinal Videos
item.description: Agent-to-Sim (ATS) learns interactive 3D agent behaviors from casual longitudinal videos using a novel coarse-to-fine registration and generative modeling approach, enabling real-to-sim transfer for v…

item.title: Alchemy: Amplifying Theorem-Proving Capability through Symbolic Mutation
item.description: Alchemy: A novel framework synthesizes formal theorems via symbolic mutation, boosting neural theorem-proving performance by significantly expanding the training dataset.

item.title: AutoTrain: No-code training for state-of-the-art models
item.description: AutoTrain: a no-code, open-source library simplifies training state-of-the-art models for diverse tasks, democratizing access to advanced AI.

item.title: Can Knowledge Editing Really Correct Hallucinations?
item.description: HalluEditBench: A new benchmark reveals whether knowledge editing truly fixes LLM hallucinations, offering insights into efficacy, generalization, and robustness.

item.title: CompassJudger-1: All-in-one Judge Model Helps Model Evaluation and Evolution
item.description: CompassJudger-1: An open-source, all-in-one judge LLM offering robust generalization and diverse evaluation capabilities, enhanced by the new JudgerBench benchmark, propelling LLM evaluation forward.

item.title: FrugalNeRF: Fast Convergence for Few-shot Novel View Synthesis without Learned Priors
item.description: FrugalNeRF: a novel few-shot NeRF, achieves high-fidelity 3D scene reconstruction with significantly faster convergence, eliminating the need for external data or complex scheduling.

item.title: Improve Vision Language Model Chain-of-thought Reasoning
item.description: Researchers enhanced vision-language model reasoning by distilling rationales from GPT-4, fine-tuning models, and applying reinforcement learning, achieving significant improvements in complex reasoni…

item.title: Language Models are Symbolic Learners in Arithmetic
item.description: LLMs don’t calculate; they’re symbolic pattern-matchers in arithmetic, mastering easy patterns first, then tackling harder ones through subgroup selection, as shown by a novel experimental framework.

item.title: LLM-based Optimization of Compound AI Systems: A Survey
item.description: This survey explores using LLMs to optimize compound AI systems, offering a unified framework based on program analysis to understand and improve LLM-based optimization strategies.

item.title: Mitigating Object Hallucination via Concentric Causal Attention
item.description: Concentric Causal Attention (CCA) significantly reduces object hallucination in Large Vision Language Models by mitigating the negative effects of long-term decay in Rotary Position Encoding.

item.title: Pangea: A Fully Open Multilingual Multimodal LLM for 39 Languages
item.description: PANGEA: A fully open multilingual, multimodal LLM for 39 languages, significantly outperforming existing models in diverse cultural contexts.

item.title: Pantograph: A Machine-to-Machine Interaction Interface for Advanced Theorem Proving, High Level Reasoning, and Data Extraction in Lean 4
item.description: Pantograph, a new Lean 4 tool, revolutionizes machine-assisted theorem proving by offering a seamless interface for integrating machine learning models and proof assistants, enabling more efficient an…

item.title: Pre-training Distillation for Large Language Models: A Design Space Exploration
item.description: Boosting LLMs: This study reveals how pre-training distillation significantly enhances large language models, exploring key design factors for optimal performance.

item.title: RM-Bench: Benchmarking Reward Models of Language Models with Subtlety and Style
item.description: RM-BENCH: a new benchmark reveals that current reward models struggle with subtle content and style, highlighting the need for improvement and better alignment of language models.

item.title: SAM2Long: Enhancing SAM 2 for Long Video Segmentation with a Training-Free Memory Tree
item.description: SAM2Long enhances video object segmentation by using a training-free memory tree, significantly improving accuracy and handling of occlusions and reappearing objects in long videos.

item.title: Selecting Influential Samples for Long Context Alignment via Homologous Models' Guidance and Contextual Awareness Measurement
item.description: GATEAU, a novel framework, leverages Homologous Models’ Guidance and Contextual Awareness Measurement to identify influential samples for enhanced long-context alignment in LLMs, boosting performance …

item.title: Steering Knowledge Selection Behaviours in LLMs via SAE-Based Representation Engineering
item.description: SPARE, a training-free method, uses sparse autoencoders to precisely steer LLMs’ knowledge selection, resolving conflicts between memory and context for improved accuracy.

item.title: xGen-MM-Vid (BLIP-3-Video): You Only Need 32 Tokens to Represent a Video Even in VLMs
item.description: BLIP-3-Video achieves state-of-the-art video question answering with only 32 visual tokens, drastically reducing computational costs while maintaining high accuracy.

item.title: Hallucination Detox: Sensitive Neuron Dropout (SeND) for Large Language Model Training
item.description: New training method, Sensitive Neuron Dropout (SeND), reduces Large Language Model (LLM) hallucinations by up to 40%, improving factual accuracy and reliability.

item.title: Ichigo: Mixed-Modal Early-Fusion Realtime Voice Assistant
item.description: Ichigo, a novel mixed-modal voice assistant, achieves real-time speech understanding and generation by using a tokenized early-fusion approach, significantly outperforming existing methods.

item.title: M-RewardBench: Evaluating Reward Models in Multilingual Settings
item.description: M-REWARDBENCH: A new multilingual benchmark reveals significant performance gaps in reward models across languages, highlighting the need for improved cross-lingual alignment in LLMs.

item.title: Baichuan Alignment Technical Report
item.description: Baichuan Alignment unveils novel techniques for aligning LLMs, boosting performance significantly across various benchmarks and user experience metrics, advancing the field towards AGI.

item.title: DM-Codec: Distilling Multimodal Representations for Speech Tokenization
item.description: DM-Codec, a novel speech tokenizer, leverages multimodal distillation to drastically improve speech quality and reduce transcription errors, outperforming state-of-the-art methods.

item.title: How Many Van Goghs Does It Take to Van Gogh? Finding the Imitation Threshold
item.description: Researchers discover the ‘imitation threshold’ in text-to-image models: around 200-600 training images are needed to reliably generate images of a specific person or art style, impacting copyright a…

item.title: Are AI Detectors Good Enough? A Survey on Quality of Datasets With Machine-Generated Texts
item.description: AI-generated text detection models struggle in real-world scenarios due to flawed training datasets; this paper provides a systematic review and proposes robust evaluation methods for these datasets.

item.title: BiGR: Harnessing Binary Latent Codes for Image Generation and Improved Visual Representation Capabilities
item.description: BiGR: a novel conditional image generation model using compact binary codes, unifying generative and discriminative tasks for improved visual representation and zero-shot generalization across multipl…

item.title: EvoPress: Towards Optimal Dynamic Model Compression via Evolutionary Search
item.description: EvoPress uses evolutionary search to optimize dynamic LLM compression, proving optimality and surpassing existing methods in accuracy and efficiency.

item.title: How Do Training Methods Influence the Utilization of Vision Models?
item.description: Training methods dramatically alter which parts of a vision model are actually used for decisions, revealing surprising variations in layer importance across different training techniques.

item.title: Montessori-Instruct: Generate Influential Training Data Tailored for Student Learning
item.description: Montessori-Instruct optimizes synthetic data generation for LLMs by aligning teacher models with student learning preferences, significantly improving student model performance.

item.title: NaturalBench: Evaluating Vision-Language Models on Natural Adversarial Samples
item.description: NaturalBench: a new benchmark reveals vision-language models struggle with simple, natural images and questions, highlighting biases and prompting development of more robust models.

item.title: Teaching Models to Balance Resisting and Accepting Persuasion
item.description: LLMs can be easily persuaded; this paper introduces Persuasion-Balanced Training (PBT) to make them both resistant to misinformation and receptive to helpful influence, leading to improved performance…

item.title: ARKit LabelMaker: A New Scale for Indoor 3D Scene Understanding
item.description: ARKit LabelMaker creates a massive, real-world 3D dataset with dense semantic labels, automatically generated to boost indoor scene understanding model performance.

item.title: CBT-Bench: Evaluating Large Language Models on Assisting Cognitive Behavior Therapy
item.description: CBT-BENCH: A new benchmark systematically evaluates LLMs’ potential for assisting Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), revealing strengths and weaknesses in various CBT tasks.

item.title: Cross-Lingual Auto Evaluation for Assessing Multilingual LLMs
item.description: The CIA Suite, a novel extensible framework, enables cross-lingual evaluation of multilingual LLMs using evaluator LLMs and a new multilingual benchmark dataset.

item.title: DAWN: Dynamic Frame Avatar with Non-autoregressive Diffusion Framework for Talking Head Video Generation
item.description: DAWN: a novel non-autoregressive diffusion framework for all-at-once generation of dynamic talking head videos, achieving higher quality and speed than autoregressive methods.

item.title: Diffusion Curriculum: Synthetic-to-Real Generative Curriculum Learning via Image-Guided Diffusion
item.description: Diffusion Curriculum Learning (DisCL) generates high-quality synthetic data via image-guided diffusion, significantly boosting accuracy in long-tail and low-quality data classification.

item.title: DPLM-2: A Multimodal Diffusion Protein Language Model
item.description: DPLM-2: a new multimodal model revolutionizes protein design by simultaneously generating protein sequences and 3D structures, surpassing existing methods in accuracy and diversity.

item.title: FiTv2: Scalable and Improved Flexible Vision Transformer for Diffusion Model
item.description: FiTv2, an enhanced vision transformer, enables efficient and high-quality image generation at arbitrary resolutions and aspect ratios, surpassing existing diffusion models.

item.title: In-context learning and Occam's razor
item.description: This study reveals that in-context learning implicitly minimizes model complexity alongside training error, providing a theoretical basis for Occam’s Razor in modern sequence models.

item.title: Looking Inward: Language Models Can Learn About Themselves by Introspection
item.description: Language models can learn about themselves through introspection, outperforming other models in self-prediction tasks, showcasing a surprising new capability and challenging prevailing assumptions abo…

item.title: MagicTailor: Component-Controllable Personalization in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: MagicTailor empowers text-to-image models with component-level control, enabling precise customization of generated images by modifying specific visual elements.

item.title: MedINST: Meta Dataset of Biomedical Instructions
item.description: MEDINST: a massive biomedical instruction dataset (133 tasks, 7M samples) improves LLM cross-task generalization in medical analysis.

item.title: PUMA: Empowering Unified MLLM with Multi-granular Visual Generation
item.description: PUMA: a unified multi-granular MLLM mastering diverse visual tasks by seamlessly integrating image generation and understanding, achieving both high diversity and precise controllability.

item.title: Router-Tuning: A Simple and Effective Approach for Enabling Dynamic-Depth in Transformers
item.description: Router-Tuning and MindSkip boost Transformer efficiency by dynamically skipping less crucial layers, achieving a 21% speedup with minimal performance loss.

item.title: SeerAttention: Learning Intrinsic Sparse Attention in Your LLMs
item.description: SeerAttention learns to automatically identify and leverage inherent attention sparsity in LLMs, drastically boosting inference speed and scalability while maintaining accuracy.

item.title: SemiEvol: Semi-supervised Fine-tuning for LLM Adaptation
item.description: SEMIEVOL: A novel semi-supervised fine-tuning framework boosts LLM performance by cleverly integrating labeled and unlabeled data via knowledge propagation and adaptive selection, enabling efficient m…

item.title: Steering Your Generalists: Improving Robotic Foundation Models via Value Guidance
item.description: Value-Guided Policy Steering (V-GPS) significantly boosts the performance of generalist robotic policies by re-ranking actions via offline RL, without retraining, improving both precision and robustne…

item.title: UCFE: A User-Centric Financial Expertise Benchmark for Large Language Models
item.description: UCFE benchmark realistically evaluates LLMs’ financial expertise via user-centric design and dynamic interactions, revealing performance gaps and highlighting the need for more robust, human-aligned m…

item.title: Web Agents with World Models: Learning and Leveraging Environment Dynamics in Web Navigation
item.description: Boosting LLM-based web agents’ performance, this study introduces World-Model-Augmented agents that simulate action outcomes for improved decision-making in complex web navigation tasks.

item.title: Context is Key(NMF): Modelling Topical Information Dynamics in Chinese Diaspora Media
item.description: KeyNMF, a novel topic modeling method, reveals how Chinese diaspora media’s information dynamics correlate with major European political events, highlighting the PRC’s potential influence.

item.title: Meta-Chunking: Learning Efficient Text Segmentation via Logical Perception
item.description: Meta-Chunking: A novel text segmentation method using LLMs improves RAG efficiency by 1.32 on 2WikiMultihopQA, consuming only 45.8% of the time compared to similarity chunking.

item.title: Mini-Omni2: Towards Open-source GPT-4o with Vision, Speech and Duplex Capabilities
item.description: Mini-Omni2: An open-source, multi-modal AI model closely replicating GPT-40’s vision, speech, and text capabilities, offering valuable insights for future research.

item.title: SHAKTI: A 2.5 Billion Parameter Small Language Model Optimized for Edge AI and Low-Resource Environments
item.description: Shakti: a 2.5B parameter LLM optimized for edge AI, boasts high performance and efficiency on resource-constrained devices via novel VGQA, SwiGLU, and RoPE.

item.title: HART: Efficient Visual Generation with Hybrid Autoregressive Transformer
item.description: HART, a novel hybrid autoregressive transformer, generates high-quality 1024x1024 images efficiently, rivaling diffusion models while being significantly faster.
